title: Kim Kardashian says Meghan Markle and Prince Harry are 'not perfect'
text:

Kim Kardashian has shared her thoughts on Meghan Markle and Prince Harry - and says people shouldn't expect them to be perfect.

The Royal couple have returned from their tour of Africa and they clearly have a fan in one of the world's most famous women.

The Duke and Duchess of Sussex spent ten days learning more about the important work of local organisations and charities.

Kim has also been far from home after being baptised in Armenia, returning to her family's historical homeland on a spiritual journey.

(Image: MEGA)

(Image: Getty)

She was asked while there about Meghan and Harry - and she clearly thinks they offer a lot to the world.

"I think that everyone makes their own choices and decisions," the star said.

"And I think that, like I said, no one's going to be perfect. I'm not, they’re not. I don't know who is.

"I still love and value the fact they bring such attention to such important movements that need to happen and things that they're really passionate about cause they're still changing the world."

(Image: Getty Images)

Kim, 38, has also spoken about teen activist Greta Thunberg.

“She is such an amazing young girl, and so brave and courageous to stand up to these grown-ups that can be very scary and for her to be so open and honest is exactly what we need,” said the star.

The Keeping Up With The Kardashians beauty took part in the Orthodox Christian ceremony, that welcomed her into the faith, alongside her children Saint, three, Chicago, 20 months, and four-month-old Psalm.

(Image: Getty Images)

Her eldest child North, six, who was baptised in Jerusalem four years ago, was also in attendance alongside Kim's sister Kourtney and her children.

"So blessed to have been baptized along with my babies," the star, 38, wrote on Instagram .

"Thank you Armenia for hosting my family and I on such a memorable trip. Mother See of Holy Etchmiadzin, Armenia's main cathedral which is sometimes referred to as the Vatican of the Armenian Apostolic Church. This church was built in 303 AD."
description: If you've ever wondered exactly what the Keeping Up With The Kardashians star thinks of the Royals, then wonder no more
